bibl.title: In Re Application of Samuel O'Brien for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Harry O'Brien. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane} SS.
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, and for the Fourth Judicial District thereof Holding terms at Spokane Falls, in said county and Territory.
In the matter of the application of Samuel O'Brien for a writ of habeas corpus for Harry O'Brien.

To the Sheriff of Spokane County: -- Greeting:
You are hereby commanded to forthwith apprehend and take into your custody the body of Harry O'Brien, and that you have him the said Harry O'Brien before the Hon. George Turner on the 12th day of July 1887, at 10 o'clock A.M. to await and abide the further order of the Court, and have you then and there this writ with your return thereon.

Witness the Hon. George Turner, Associate Justice of the Supreme Court, and Judge of said Court, and the seal thereof affixed, this 9th July A.D. 1887.
D.A. Clement, Clerk.
Territory of Washington County of Spokane } SS.

I James Glispin Sheriff of Spokane County WT. I hereby certify that I have served the within writ on the within named Harry OBrien on this the 9. Day of July AD 1887 in Spokane County WT. and now have him in court as directed.

James Glispin
Sheriff of Spokane County.
By A.J. Duncan
Deputy
